rComments: I HATE THE TEXTBOOK WITH A PASSION. why assign 20 pages of pure boring to read every week. why not teach it properly in class instead of just quickly saying everything that's already on the slides.

I am personally not a pro at chem; in fact, I did incredibly poorly in the prerequisite for this course. But Dr. Revers cares about his students, and if you care about your mark and your learning, it will be clear that he does too. He makes you think instead of regurgitate information! One of my favourite profs, for very difficult content!

This course was difficult yet rewarding. The content is quite intense, however, once you get the main idea, you will understand anything he throws at you. I highly recommend attending his office hours. Unlike many profs, Prof. Revers is passionate about what he teaches. He wants to help students to do well and appreciate the elegance of Orgo Chem.
His tests are way harder than his lectures. He is looking for the gifted chemists not students.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: He likes to test you to the extent, where your entire life revolves around Chemistry. If you love to study, you'll love this prof! Personally, not for me
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: If you are taking CHM243 in the summer definitely take this course with him! Don't let the midterm mark discourage you because he will off-set the midterm mark by replacing it with the final exam; you'll do better. This is coming from a student who wanted to drop the course. Make sure to go to office hours, they actually do help a lot!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: I know its difficult to avoid him since he's teaching one of the most core chemistry courses but tbh I don't think he actually cares his students to do well whatsoever. Yes he might have a nice resume that's enough to get a faculty job, but that doesn't really reflect his actual ability to create fair learning environments.

Revers is a very smart guy and he tries his best to make himself available to answer all of your questions, which is great, but the content is just unbelievably difficult. Idk if he expected too much out of us or just tested very difficult, but he's the reason I've decided to drop out of my chemistry major lmao

If you are a chem specialist, def consider taking CHM242/243 with him as he enforces application of concepts more than anything. and that will really help you with  advanced chemistry courses. However, you HAVE to be willing to commit a lot of time to this course. I mean  A LOT of time. Attendance is optional but please just go.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Leigh Revers is a one-of-a-kind professor at the University of Toronto. He will make you a real chemist. If you're all about memorization, don't take his courses. Dr. Revers will teach you how to understand organic chemistry from a purely intuitive perspective, unlike the majority of instructors.   Leigh Revers knows Chemistry.

Let me be frank. This isn't just a med school checkmark. OChem a demanding course which requires a large time commitment. Revers delivers a breadth of material clearly using simple language and relevant examples. Revers was our guide through the textbook, not our babysitter. Study well, and you will do well. His office hours were straight from God.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Respected', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Awesome Professor! He is very approachable and always there to help!

This is an OChem course, naturally, it is hard. Professor Revers presents the material at the baseline and gives you the skills to learn more. Remember this is OChem and just because you got a low grade due to the fact that you did not take the course seriously and learn the more complex problems that relate to the basics does not make Revers bad.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Lots of homework', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Prof Leigh presented this complex course in a way which was easily comprehended. Organic chemistry is hard to grasp; however, with his help you will get a much better understanding and succeed. He provides much of his time and effort in assisting during office hours. I learnt a lot in his course and would definitely recommend courses with him!

The material of chm243 may be tough but professor Revers was very helpful. He provides amazing lectures that are easier to understand and really helpful office hours as well. It is not difficult to keep up with the amount of work if you really try.

CHM 243 will make you work hard. Professor Revers is passionate about chemistry and is eager to help students,all you have to do is dedicate yourself to go to office hours and to study hard. He's all about learning the concept,and not memorizing. Best class I ever took, I was motivated the entire semester! It's an enriching course!
teacherRatingTags: ['Inspirational', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: The most helpful prof in the chemistry department of UTM you will ever meet ( with an amazing British accent:). The exam was very fair and truly tested the students' understanding and work, with some challenging questions (since it's organic). Many chances to get easy marks from assignments and extra help+practice during office hours.

Revers is a great prof and is very approachable. His tests and exam s  are difficult (aka clever) but if u want to learn organic chemistry then he is the guy! Go to his office hours, understand the material and just don't do things like u did with Jumi! His tests are more based on understanding rather than memorizing answers to past tests.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Chm243 is a hard course in general. I definitely could've done better if I tried harder from the beginning. Dr Revers is a great prof, he goes through so many examples and answers everyone's questions. If you want to do well in the class don't take the short cuts. Actually try hard, practice and use him as a resource because he helps.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He is a great prof who really know his material, and his textbook choice helped me learn the material from scratch. I worked very hard to do decent in this course, and for the difficulty of the material, his willingness to help outside of class and his mark distribution is very fair. I definitely recommend learning from him.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Your mark may drop significantly with the exam, even if you walk in with a high grade. His lectures are mostly pictures from the textbook; studying from the textbook is your best option. His midterms are doable, but exams, not so much. Aside from that, he can be extremely rude or okay somtimes, depending on his mood.
What is up with that midterm and that exam. I hope I pass the course...

He is accessible outside class, he is very nice, he is knowledgeable, he teaches good, I like this prof BUT his tests are so difficult and he expects you to know a lot which is not fair to us who took the course with him and ended up with a lower grade than students who took the same course with another prof who has much easier exams.

Goes way to fast during lectures and only teaches though powerpoint with no hand written examples, which makes the material harder to learn.  Very picky grader, in WASPS he gives you an automatic zero if you forget to write down any of your information at the top of the sheet (including the date). Does not clarify any concepts before moving on.

This professor is not skilled in teaching. Most of the tests have to skewed as majority of the class fails. He is an intelligent man but does not know how to teach in accordance to the tests. I would not recommend his course.

He is a smart man but doesn't know how to teach. The midterm was horrible and the class average was a failing grade. He needs to work on his teaching methods, I don't feel like the midterm reflected what we learned in class.

He is a smart person, he is always there for help, he gives extra tie for students who shows interest. Always attend office hours to do well in the course. He is one of the best teachers that teach from the heart, not from the book
Amazing Prof for Chemistry, Knows his material really well.

Very passionate, and ALWAYS ready to help out students! Classes are incredibly interesting and his lecturing style makes it simple to follow. He can make boring material the most fascinating thing you'll learn. He is definitely to the point. the course is well structured. I like his teaching style :)

Okay here's the truth. This guy is Extremely smart, and he wants you to use your brain in his class. Read the material before class. You have to learn to solve problems, not just blindly follow rules. He is the only teacher that will teach you how to do chemistry and also work effectively. He is the greatest teacher I had at the university.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Terrible professor, avoid at all costs

The most awful prof I've ever come across. Teaches chemistry with powerpoint and very little hand-written examples. He teaches so poorly he constantly has to skew marks since majority of the students fail his tests. Insincere and rude. Save yourself the time and money, and do not take chm243 with him. He will ruin chemistry for you.

This class is incredibly tough; lots of reactions and reagents to understand. Tests and Exams are way too hard, though he loves to bell curve marks up. Problem set answers are online (25% of mark), labs are easy. Best choice to people who will struggle in this class, as you are essentially guaranteed a mid 60% no matter what

Organic chemistry is hard on its - that's not any professor's fault. However, being tested on material not covered in the slightest way IS the professor's fault. Teaching a set of things and being examined on totally different grounds IS the professor's fault. Save yourself the misery and take the course at another institution.

WASPS and the Stand-up things are basically a free 20% of your mark (all answers are online). Labs can be mark boosters depending on your TA. Midterm and Exam destroy your mark (class averages of 25%). Online resources/practice problems are essentially mandatory for this course, as the textbook hardly contains any.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: He is a friendly prof, but doesn't  teach all that well. Chemistry needs a professor that makes sure you understand before moving on - something Leigh doesn't do. He zips through the material with useless powerpoint slides from the textbook (with no text on them!) Having not done any chemistry in a really long time, he's the one learning, not us.!
A hard marker! Available for help when needed.
Great professor who provided his students with great insights regarding the biotech industry. A great mentor and a great educator.
this prof is amazing!!!!! if you dont understand basic business skills then you will not appreciate this class. he is smart and funny during lectures! highly recommended

Prof. Revers gives excellent lectures and works hard to make the material interesting. Criticisms: Loves to talk about his car. Outrageously rude to ESL students - ridiculed a girl in class for her trouble understanding the word "balsamic" in a quiz question. "It's English - if you don't understand it, that's not my problem."
